rules: Rule1: Either the weather permits outdoor work, or if the day shift work shift is not active, then the generator has sufficient fuel.
Rule2: Either the site manager supervisor is present, or the crew lead foreman is present.
Rule3: Whenever the crew lead foreman is present, the weather does not permit outdoor work.
Rule4: If steel beams materials are available, then rebar materials are available.
Rule5: Either steel beams materials are available, or if the site manager supervisor is present, then the weather does not permit outdoor work.
Rule6: In the event that phase 1 of the project is on schedule, milestone 1 deadline is met.
Rule7: Should milestone 1 deadline be met, then either the crane equipment is functional, or if the day shift work shift is not active, then tools have power available.
Rule8: Assuming inspection quality standards are met, then if the compactor equipment is available, concrete material is not delayed.
Rule9: Provided that concrete samples testing is completed, inspection quality standards are met.
Rule10: Whenever soil samples testing is completed, inspection quality standards are met.
Rule11: If materials lab results are approved, then concrete samples testing is completed.
Rule12: Either materials lab results are approved, or compaction field tests have passed.
Rule13: In the case that compaction field tests have passed, soil samples testing is completed.
Rule14: Should the excavation inspection pass, then the engineer has approved the excavation.
Rule15: Given that excavation documentation is complete, the excavation inspection has passed.
Rule16: If steel shipment materials are delayed, then steel beams materials are not available.
Rule17: Either steel shipment materials are delayed, or beam delivery materials are damaged.
Rule18: Whenever the bulldozer equipment is available, concrete material is not delayed.
Rule19: Either the bulldozer equipment is available, or the compactor equipment is available.
Rule20: If a safety violation by workers is observed, then crew safety training is required.
Rule21: Should work be stopped due to safety concerns, the weather does not permit outdoor work.
Rule22: If generator maintenance is performed, then generator maintenance is logged.
Rule23: Whenever generator maintenance is logged, then if the day shift work shift is not active, tools have power available.
Rule24: Should excavation work be completed, the trench safety check has passed.
Rule25: If excavation work is completed, then excavation depth specification is not achieved.
Rule26: Either excavation work is completed, or the day shift work shift is active.
Rule27: In the event that it is not the case that if beam delivery materials are damaged then steel beams materials are not available, then backup beams materials are ordered.
Rule28: Should it not be true that if backup beams materials are ordered then an alternative steel supplier has been contacted, then the steel supplier contract is terminated.
Rule29: Provided that it is not the case that if crew safety training is required then work is stopped due to safety concerns, then safety training is completed.
Rule30: If it is not the case that if crew safety training is required then work is stopped due to safety concerns, then safety training is not completed.
Rule31: In the case that it is not the case that if the compactor equipment is available then concrete material is not delayed, then the foundation site is prepared.
Rule32: Assuming it is not the case that if the compactor equipment is available then concrete material is not delayed, then the foundation site is not prepared.
Rule33: Whenever it is not the case that if excavation work is completed then excavation depth specification is achieved, excavation documentation is complete.
Rule34: In the event that it is not the case that if excavation work is completed then the trench safety check has not passed, then the excavation permit is approved.
Rule35: Provided that it is not the case that if excavation work is completed then the trench safety check has not passed, then the excavation permit is not approved.
Rule36: If it is not the case that if the day shift work shift is not active then the excavator crane is not operational, then concrete material is delayed.
Rule37: If the day shift work shift is not active, then the excavator crane is operational.
Rule38: Assuming the day shift work shift is not active, tools do not have power available.
facts: Fact1: Phase 1 of the project is on schedule.
Fact2: A safety violation by workers is observed.
Fact4: Rebar materials are not available.
Fact5: The crane equipment is not functional.
Fact6: The engineer has not approved the excavation.
Fact7: An alternative steel supplier has not been contacted.
Fact8: The steel supplier contract is not terminated.
Fact9: The generator does not have sufficient fuel.

question: The day shift work shift is active.
